poem:
Title: "The Silent Chorus of Classrooms"

The best actors in the daily school-play,
portraying knowledge's curious dance,
are not starred in films or draped in praise.
Yet, in the quiet hum of chalk and thought,
they craft the narratives of our youth,
Uncelebrated, they plant ideas, like apple seeds,
trusting the script of a triumphant harvest,
unedited, unseen, in the minds of those they teach.
